title: Heavenly Mathematics and Cultural Astronomy
description:
Students will study astronomy in a cultural context and
look at questions like: How is the date of Chinese New
Year determined? Why do the Muslim and Chinese
months start on different days? Why was the date of
Deepavali moved some years ago? Will the Moon ever
look like it does on the Singapore flag? This module will
help students appreciate mankind’s effort to understand
the mathematics of heavens and how the sky modulates
culture.
prerequisite: GEM1918 or GEM1919 or UTC1700 or UTC1701 or UTC1702%
